property.name: Outfit
property.value: Lost Angels

property.name: Text
property.value: Experienced. Noon: Target a Dude at this location with one or more Spells attached. Abel calls out the Dude.

property.name: Text
property.value: While there is at least one Terror at this location, the Fear level is increased by 1 (maximum 10).

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon: Target a Dude in play. The Dude has a -2 Bullet penalty (minimum 0) and a -2 Influence penalty (minimum 0) until after Nightfall while in the Town Square.

property.name: Text
property.value: All Deeds with 'Church', 'Chapel', or 'Mission' in their title have their Production increased by +2 and are worth 1 additional Control Point, until after Nightfall.

property.name: Text
property.value: Private. Controller Noon: Boot this Deed to target a Bullet card in your Boot Hill. Move that card to your discard pile. Controller Noon: Boot this Deed to target a Bullet card in your discard pile. Shuffle that card into your deck.

property.name: Text
property.value: Reaction: Use when another player declares the target of a job. You may unboot up to two of your Dudes that are at or adjcent to the target's location.

property.name: Text
property.value: Abomination. There is no limit to the number of Animate Hands that each player may have in play. Animate Hands cannot attach Goods. Card memory does not apply to Animate Hands. Any Dudes with higher Values in a posse opposing an Animate Hand have the ability -'Shootout: Boot this Dude to Ace an Animate Hand in the opposing posse. Reduce this Dude's Bullet rating to 0 until the end of the shootout.'

property.name: Text
property.value: When April calls out a Wanted dude, that dude may not refuse.

property.name: Text
property.value: Select a Terror in play. The Terror is booted and may not be targeted with actions this turn.

property.name: Text
property.value: Huckster. Shootout Hex X: Target a Dude in the opposing posse. X is the Value of the Dude. If the Hex succeeds, the Dude's text box is blank until the end of this shootout.

property.name: Text
property.value: Mad Scientist:1. Barney may not create non-Weapon Gadgets. If Barney has a Weapon Gadget ready, he does not need to boot to join a posse in an adjacent location.

property.name: Text
property.value: Reaction: Play when one of your Dudes is called out. Your Dude refuses the call out and must move to an adjacent location. If your Dude is not Wanted, the Dude who called your Dude out becomes Wanted.

property.name: Text
property.value: Mad Scientist. Unique. Gadget Difficulty: 9 Noon Pull: Target a Dude in play and make a skill check using this Dude's Mad Scientist skill (if any). If the skill check exceeds the target Dude's Value, all copies of the target become non-Unique and players may have any number of that Dude in play. Card memory does not apply to copies of that Dude. These changes are permanent.

property.name: Outfit
property.value: Sioux Union

property.name: Text
property.value: Bites the Hand may not attach Goods cards that can only be attached to Sioux Dudes.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon: Boot this Outfit and pay 2 Ghost Rock to get a Job Action card from your deck, show it to the other players, and add it to your Play hand. Discard a card from your Play hand and shuffle your deck.

property.name: Text
property.value: Private. Out of Town. Controller Noon: Target a skilled Dude at this location. That Dude's skill is doubled for his or her next Skill Check this turn. After that Skill Check, the Dude loses the skill until after Nightfall.

property.name: Text
property.value: Private. Control of the Arena is determined using Bullet ratings instead of Influence. Controller Noon: Target two Dudes at this location controlled by different players. Those Dudes start a shootout which other Dudes cannot join. All cards attached to those Dudes are considered blank until the end of the shootout.

property.name: Text
property.value: Shaman. Noon Spirit 6: Target one of your booted Dudes. If this Spirit succeeds, boot this Shaman to unboot the target Dude.

property.name: Text
property.value: Bullet. Shootout: Target a Wanted Dude in the opposing posse. Ace the Brimstone Bullets to ace the target Dude.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon Harrowed Power: Target one of your unbooted Harrowed Dude. Until the end of the game, the Dude has the ability: 'Noon: Target a Dude in this location with a lower Value and move the Dude to his or her home. That Dude may not move to this location until after Nightfall. Ace this card.

property.name: Text
property.value: Blessed. Noon Miracle 9: Target a Dude in Boot Hill. If this Miracle succeeds, move that Dude to his or her owner's discard pile.

property.name: Text
property.value: Once this turn, as a Noon action, youi may unboot one Terror in play. Ace this card.

property.value: Lost Angels

property.name: Text
property.value: Experineced. Shootout: Target a Draw Dude in Cain's Posse with the Blessed or Huckster skill. The Dude is a Stud until after Nightfall.

property.name: Text
property.value: Private. Government. Texas Rangers Dudes may not move to this Location. The Ghost Rock cost to bring this Deed into play is reduced by 2 if you are an Agency player.

property.name: Text
property.value: Experienced. Charlie cannot be called out or move to a location you do not control. While Charlie is in a Saloon, that Saloon gains a +1 Control Point bonus.

property.name: Text
property.value: A Dude may only have one 'Chip' attached. This Dude may not refuse a call out.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon: Target a Dude in play. The Dude has a -1 Bullet penalty (minimum 0) and a -1 Influence penalty (minimum 0) until after Nightfall while at an in-town Deed or their Home.

property.name: Text
property.value: Reaction: Play immediately before one of your Dudes becomes Wanted. Move the Dude to an out-of-town location, and the Dude no longer becomes Wanted.

property.name: Text
property.value: Mystical. Reaction: Boot the Devilbunny when this Dude is Aced. If you are the Winner, the Dude is not aced, but is sent home booted instead. This Dude does not unboot during Nightfall this turn.

property.name: Text
property.value: Public. Holy Ground. Wanted Dues are not considered Wanted while at this location.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon Job: Boot one of your Dudes to start a job that targets the Town Square. Any player may defend the job, starting with the Winner and going clockwise. Before posses are formed, select an in-town Deed with a Ghost Rock cost less than 7 and show it to the other players. If the job succeeds, put the Deed into play with no Ghost Rock cost. If the job fails, put the Deed into Boot Hill.

property.name: Text
property.value: Experienced Darren's Influence cannot be greater than 1 while at home. Noon: Give Darren an Influence bonus up to the number of your Dudes in this location. Darren's Upkeep cost is increased by an equal amount. The Influence bonus lasts until after Nightfall this turn, and the increased Upkeep cost lasts until after Nightfall next turn.

property.name: Text
property.value: Blessed:0. Noon: Reduce David's Value by 2 permanently. David gains +3 to his Blessed skill until after Nightfall. If David's Value is less than 2, he is Aced.

property.name: Text
property.value: Private. Strike. Controller Reaction: Immediately after a Dude at this location is Aced, increase the Production of this Deed by 1, permanently.

property.name: Outfit
property.value: Lost Angels

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon: Target a Dude with a Spell or Mystical Goods card attached. That Dude becomes Wanted until after Nightfall.

property.name: Text
property.value: Reaction: Play when another player brings a Dude from a different Outfit into play. Increase the Upkeep cost of that Dude by 3 until after Nightfall next turn.

property.name: Text
property.value: Reaction: Play after a Spell resolves. Ace the Spell.

property.name: Text
property.value: Cheatin'! Reaction: Play when another player reveals an illegal Draw hand. Target a Dude controlled by that player whose Value is less than the illegal Draw hand's rank plus 4. You take control of the Dude until after Nightfall. Only one Cheatin'! Card can be played against a player per draw.

property.name: Text
property.value: Huckster:2. Experienced.

property.name: Text
property.value: Mad Scientist:1. Reaction Pull: Boot Dr. Hardstrom when you bring a Terror into play. If the pull is less than the Terror's Value, the Terror gains a permanent +2 Bullet bonus.

property.name: Text
property.value: Blessed. Shootout Miracle 4: If this Miracle succeeds, you may Draw one additional card to make your Draw hand for this round of the shootout. Shootout Miracle 8: If this Miracle succeeds, you may draw two additional cards to make your Draw hand for this round of the shootout.

property.name: Text
property.value: Unique. Mystical. Weapon. Noon: This Dude gains an Influence bonus or a Bullet bonus (you choose) equal to the number of your Shamen in Boot Hill, until after Nightfall.

property.name: Text
property.value: Experienced-2. Shootout: Move Eagle Rock to the location of the shootout, ignoring movement restrictions. Eagle Rock joins your posse. Shootout: Target one of your other Dudes in this shootout. Move the Dude to another location that is out of town - the Dude is no longer in the shootout. This action may be used any number of times per turn.

property.name: Text
property.value: Private. When the Mausoleum controller's Harrowed Dudes are Aced, that player performs the Harrowed pull from his or her own deck.

property.name: Outfit
property.value: Lost Angels

property.value: Blessed:4. Experienced 2. Noon Job: Boot Elijah to start a job that target another player's Dude with a Mystical Goods card attached. If the job succeeds, the Dude and Goods card are Aced (if still in play), and you gain 1 Victory Point.

property.name: Text
property.value: Reaction Pull: Play when you fail a Gadget skill check. If the new Pull is red, the skill check succeeds and the Mad Scientist becomes wanted.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon: Boot Evans to protect this location. Until after Nightfall, other players' Dudes with a lower Value than Evan's may not move to this location.

property.name: Text
property.value: Non-Unique. Private. Out-of-Town. The Ghost Rock cost of the Exploratory Trench is increased by 1 for each Exploratory Trench already in play.

property.name: Text
property.value: Reaction: Play when one of your Dudes is targeted with a Spell. If your Dude's Value is greater than the Value of the Dude casting the Spell, the Spell fails.

property.name: Text
property.value: Blessed:1. Experienced. Reaction: Use when you bring a Blessed into play with a higher Blessed skill than Father Terrance. Boot Father Terrance to get any 3 cards from your deck. Shuffle your deck, then place those 3 cards on top of your deck in any order.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon: Target a Saloon in play. Until after Nightfall next turn, that Deed's Control Points and Production are reduced to 0.

property.name: Text
property.value: Huckster. Noon Hex 10: Target one of your other Dudes in the same location as this Huckster. If the Hex succeeds, the target Dude gains the Skill: Huckster 1 and becomes a Stud until the end of the game. If the Hex fails, the target Dude is removed from play, and no other copies of the Dude may enter play for the rest of the game.

property.name: Text
property.value: Reaction: Play immediately before you Ace casualties in a shootout. Ace the highest Value Dude in your posse. Card effects cannot prevent this Dude from being aced or going to Boot Hill - Harrowed Dudes do not make a pull. The number of your casualties in this round of the shootout is reduced to zero.

property.name: Text
property.value: Bullet. Shootout: Ace the Flashfire Bullets to send home all Dudes in the opposing posse who have a Value less than or equal to this Dude's Bullet rating.

property.name: Text
property.value: Cheatin'! Reaction: Play when another player reveals an illegal Draw hand. Until the end of the game, whenever that player reveals an illegal Draw hand (including this one), that player must either make one of his or her un-Wanted Dudes Wanted, or Ace one of his or her Wanted Dudes. Only one Cheatin! Card can be played against a player per draw.

property.name: Text
property.value: Public. After each Upkeep Phase, the Freak Show's Production and Control Points are reduced by 1, permanently. If this Deed ever has a production of 0, it is removed from play and no other copies can be played for the rest of the game. Terrors have a +1 Influence bonus while at the Freak Show.

property.value: Noon: Target one of your Dudes. Move the Dude to a location that you own, but do not control.

property.value: Reaction: Play when posses are being formed for a Shootout. Boot one of your Dudes, regardless of location, to move him or her into your posse.

property.name: Text
property.value: Shootout: Boot one of your Dudes in this shootout to Draw cards into your Play hand equal to the Dude's Value minus 10 (minimum 0 and maximum 3. For example, booting a Queen would draw 2 cards).

property.value: Reaction: Play when your posse wins a round of a shootout. Your lead Shooter gains a +1 Influence bonus, permanently. Ace this card.

property.value: This Improvement may only be attached to an in-town Deed with production greater than zero.

property.value: Shootout: Boot Jack to target a Stud Dude in the opposing posse. The Dude becomes a Draw until the end of the shootout.

property.name: Text
property.value: Reaction: Boot Jack immediately before Nightfall to target another player's Dude who is alone at an in-town location. Jack moves to that location and calls the Dude out to a shootout that cannot be refused. Jack gains a +2 Bullet bonus until after Nightfall.

property.value: Shootout: Pay all costs for a non-Gadget Goods in your Play hand and attach it to one of your Dudes in this shootout, regardless of who controls the location. If the Goods is a Weapon, it can be readied immediately.

property.value: Reaction: Play after one of your Dudes with a Mystical Goods card attached has been Aced. Attach that Mystical Goods card to any one of your Dudes that may legally attach the Goods card, or place it in your discard pile.

property.value: Old Scratch may attach (but not use) any Spell card - Your Blessed, Hucksters, and Shamen in the same location as Old Scratch may use Spells attached to Old Scratch as if they were attached to themselves. A Spell may only be used once per turn in this fashion.

property.name: Text
property.value: Cheatin'! Reaction: Play when another player reveals an illegal Draw hand. You may change the value and suit of one card in your Draw hand as if it were a Joker. Only one Cheatin'! card can be played against a player per draw.

property.value: Public. Controller Noon: Pay 1 Ghost Rock to target a Goods or Spell in your Boot Hill. Shuffle that card into your deck.

property.name: Text
property.value: Put one to four Ghost Rock into the 'pot', matching that amount from the Bank. Any other player may play by matching the amount from their vault. Each participating player Draws seven cards to make his or her Draw hand, with the best hand winning the pot. Players revealing an illegal hand cannot win the pot (if all players reveal an illegal hand, the pot goes to the Bank).

property.value: Private. Government. Agency Dudes may not move to this Location. The Ghost Rock cost to bring this Deed into play is reduced by 2 if you are a Texas Rangers player.

property.name: Text
property.value: Unique. Mystical. Reaction: Boot this Dude immediately before the Gambling Phase. Any player that does not ante 2 additional Ghost Rock may not resolve any events during low ball.

property.name: Text
property.value: Public. Out of Town. Brothel. Saloon. Controller Noon: Unboot all dudes at this location.

property.name: Outfit
property.value: Sioux Union

property.name: Text
property.value: Dudes you Ace in a shootout are removed from play - no Harrowed pulls are made, and card effects cannot be used to prevent the Dude being aced. No other copies of those Dudes may enter play for the rest of the game.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon: All Wanted Dudes in play have a Draw Bullet type until after Nightfall. Ace this card.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon: Use when this Dude is in the Town Square. Gain 1 Ghost Rock. Noon Pull: Boot this Dude while he or she is in the Town Square to target another Dude in the Town Square. If the pull is greater than the target Dude's Value, take 1 Ghost Rock from his or her controller.

property.name: Text
property.value: This Dude's Value is increased by 3 (maximum K). A Dude may only attach one Three-Piece Suit.

property.name: Outfit
property.value: Sioux Union

property.name: Text
property.value: Shaman:4. Experienced. Noon: Ace a Spirit attached to Thunderbird to get a card from your discard pile and add it to your Play hand.

property.name: Text
property.value: Reaction: Play when an action on a Horse card is used. That action is canceled and has no effect. Noon: Discard a Horse card from play.

property.name: Outfit
property.value: Sioux Union

property.name: Text
property.value: Shaman:1. Experienced. Two Birds has a +2 Biullet bonus and a +2 Influence bonus while he has one or more Goods attached that can only be attached to a Sioux.

property.name: Text
property.value: Huckster:2. Experienced. Noon: This action can only be used once per game. Target a Dude in play with a Value less than Tzipprorah's. Until the end of the game, you may perform the following actioin once per turn. Noon: Put a Spell card from your Play hand into Boot Hill to boot the targeted Dude.

property.name: Text
property.value: Reaction: Play immediately before another player makes a pull. The pull is Drawn from any deck you choose.

property.name: Text
property.value: Shaman. Noon Spirit 4: If this Spirit succeeds, this Dude is a Stud until after Nightfall. Shootout Spirit 8: Target another of your Dudes in this posse. If this Spirit succeeds, both this Shaman and the target Dude are Studs until the end of the shootout.

property.name: Text
property.value: Non-Unique. Public. Saloon. Dudes moving to the Watering Hole are booted.

property.name: Text
property.value: Unique. You must boot a Blessed Dude to put this Improvement into play. This Improvement may only be attached to an in-town Deed. Dudes Aced at this location are not aced, but are discarded instead. If the Dude is a Blessed, the Dude is sent home booted.

property.name: Text
property.value: Reaction: Play when one of your Dudes is called out. The Dude refuses the call out, moves home booted, and becomes Wanted.

property.name: Text
property.value: William gains a +2 Bullet bonus while he is Wanted.

property.name: Text
property.value: Select a Deed. Beginning with the player on your left, each player may move one Dude to that Deed.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon Job: Target a skilled Dude in play. Boot one of your Dudes to start a job to recruit that Dude. If the job succeeds, pay the target's controller 2 Ghost Rock to take control of the Dude until after Nightfall. The Dude moves to your home and unboots (if necessary). If the target is Aced during the shootout, the target is not aced (regardless of card effects), and the job is immediately successful. Immediately before Nightfall, if still in play, the Dude returns to his or her owner's control and goes home booted.

property.name: Text
property.value: Noon Job: Boot one of your Dudes at an out-of-town Deed owned by another player. The Dude starts a job that targets that Deed. If the job succeeds, take an amount of Ghost Rock from that player equal to the Deed's current production, or the player's total Ghost Rock if less. All Dudes in your posse become Wanted.

property.name: Text
property.value: Zeke is a Stud while he is at a Strike.
